Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, with small improvements, could be much better.”
Reviews.Author: James K
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, friendly staff and nice atmosphere (reception staff had good English), room not huge but very comfortable. The location is close to the Pigalle section of the city, which is supposed to be the 'seedy red-light district', but is actually quite tame. Only 2 negatives to report- the soundproofing in the room we stayed in was very poor, and there was only a short shower screen in the bath/shower, so it was impossible not to soak the floor of the bathroom. Otherwise the shower was great, as was the hotel in general. We were assured that the issues we highlighted would be put forward to the manager immediately. Should these be fixed, we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would happily stay there again ourselves on any future trip to this enchanting city.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: Julie K
Reviews.Content: We always hold our breathe when opening the doors to hotel rooms in the past, and most of the time we are disappointed ......but not this time! The decor was very clean,light, airy and modern, not the biggest of rooms but it had everything you needed. My one gripe would be that there were no tea making facilities in the room....but the hotel did offer free soft drinks downstairs. We had a great time in Paris and were very lucky with the weather too....20' in march!! Would definitely return or use one of their sister hotels in the future. The lady manager (who spoke 4 languages) was wonderful and couldn't do enough for you.....thanks for a enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and location.”
Reviews.Author: mrxavi
Reviews.Content: I have become a loyal of this hotel since I tried it last year. It is a nice boutique hotel located in a great area of Paris. Nice personnel, clean and breakfast is included. Definitely recommended if you want to get out of the big-chain hotels and feel a bit more at home :-) Will surely come back. Oh, there are actually 2 hotels one in front of the other it is the same one but the other is named Joyce. It might happen that you end up in that one which is as nice as the other so nothing to worry about!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel shame about the rugby”
Reviews.Author: Andymca
Reviews.Content: I travelled tp Paris with my Father to watch the rugby in Feb 12. We arrived late about 10pm and we given a very friendly welcome. Everything was explained clearly and we were given helpful info were to eat at such a time. The room as on the 1st floor looking onto Rue la Bruyere. The bathroom was very clean and the room was a reasonable size. All you can ask for on a short break. The continental breakfast in the morning was very good and the relaxed atmosphere made it an enjoyable hassle free event. Try and avoid the peak times as the seating is limited. The hotel was short walk between 2 metro stops making any destination very accessible. I would have no hesitation using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay there again”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, great breakfast. Clean and nice decor. Only minor complaint was the air-conditioning in our room. Made the air quite stuffy - reminded me of being on a ryanair flight. Other than that, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lia K
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Good breakfast. Clean rooms. Personnel very polite and helpfull. Open bar after 14:00. But too expensive for what really offers.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was too much!”
Reviews.Author: MatthewE1981
Reviews.Content: The staff were amazing and it made all the difference to our stay. We also enjoyed the complimentary snacks and beverages on offer, although only small, they made all the difference in such a pricey city! The room was immaculate too, with balcony and a great view. If you have a lot of luggage, there is a lift, although it's quite tiny! I'd definitely stay with the same group of hotels again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “good efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelvinmost
Reviews.Content: very good location, helpfull reseption stuff, nice kitchen, coffee machine and nice cakes availuble all day

Reviews.Title: “A good clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: markdgoddard
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel based on a recommendation from Trip Advisor. The hotel was modern, clean and staff were friendly. 10 mins by taxi from Gard de Nord. it is in a good location for plenty of good restaurants, and is walking distance to the Sacre Coeur.

Reviews.Title: “Very good relation Quality- Price.”
Reviews.Author: xareco
Reviews.Content: Monterosa hotel was indeed a good choice for us. It's clean, as the minimum and necessary services, good location (near montmartre, opera and moulin rouge and subway) and not a bad Price When we are taking about Paris. We recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern and clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: poppy425
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stayed at the Monterosa. We had booked our hotel through hotels4u.com and got a really good price for our 3 nights stay. We got room 504 on arrival as we requested this on our booking form, this was based on recommendation by another Tripadvisor user. Our room was on the fifth floor (top floor), it looks out on the courtyard and was very quiet. The view is nothing special but at least it wasn't noisy at all! Our room was of a decent size and it was very clean. It had modern decor and had flat screen TV, a safe etc. The bathroom was of a good size, nice clean towels and shower gel etc provided. The selection of food at breakfast was very good, lots of croissants, bread, different types of ham and cheese, yoghurts, fresh fruit, juices etc. There's also a coffee machine and a good selection of teas. we enjoyed our breakfast everyday and it was definitely a good start for our long days of museums and sightseeing! The selection of coffees, teas, soft drinks are free throughout the day until 10pm, much better than the usual silly prices you have to pay for the mini bar in hotel rooms! Wi-fi is also free as well. The hotel is situated in a quiet area, within 3 to 5 minute walking distance to either the Pigalle or the Saint-Georges which are really handy metro lines for getting around and sightseeing! It's also within walking distance to the LaFayette department store, Opera area etc. The staff at the hotel are always helpful and very friendly. We really enjoyed our stay at the Monterosa and we are already talking about coming back to this hotel for our next Paris trip! we cannot wait to go back and would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in close proximity to the subway”
Reviews.Author: P D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monterosa in December for 5 nights. The hotel's complimentary breakfast buffet and afternoon snacks and drinks were very much appreciated. It was great to have a room on the second floor as we didn't have to take the elevator often. As others have noted, the elevator is small but was functional during our visit. The staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I found my home in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Nanda_BR
Reviews.Content: Never had such a pleasant stay in a 3 star hotel. The staff is superb: helpful at all times. The decoration is nice, everything is brand new and works well. The beds are comfortable. Satellite TV with lots of international channels was also great. It was really cold when we stayed there and the heating worked well, same with the bedding, pillows, duvet all adequate and very comfortable, we could sleep forever and woke up rested everyday! Breakfast was also nice. Free wi-fi internet that works really well (and you don't have to leave your room to use it) is just the icing in the cake. I never heard other guests although there were others in my floor and the street where the hotel is located is a quiet one. I can't recommend this place enough and will come back to it many times!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!! Horrible, dirty and noisy!”
Reviews.Author: NAD_BXL
Reviews.Content: Tiny room. But that's normal in Paris. Confortable bed. Nice personnel. BUT: No sound isolation whatsoever! You'll have no choice but share all your neighbors experiences! Including the bathroom ones! Horrible horrible horrible smell of sewer in the room and bathroom. All the time! Very very noisy corridors, cleaning service and other rooms' doors slamming. Dirty shower with black/dirt stains on the doors. Informed the reception about that, asking them to clean the bathroom "for real", but didn't change a thing! And way too expensive compared to other trendy/design in Paris, that were much better. I don't understand all the good reviews! There are way too many! Either there are 2 Monterosa in the same street, or...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel! - Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: SummerBaby08
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 4 nights in this hotel with my boyfriend and I loved it! The hotel is clean and chic. Our room was a lot bigger than expected and we had a nice sized bathroom with a lovely deep bath - excellent for when you have been out in a very cold Paris all day! We could help ourselves to drinks and snacks (water, orange, coke, crisps etc.) which I thought was a nice touch to the hotel. The hotel staff were all lovely and extremely helpful and polite. Breakfast was simple continental food but was certainly enjoyable. Location was great, barely 5 mins from St Georges metro and once you are in the metro, anywhere is easily accessible. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, although beds were so comfy I struggled to get my boyfriend out of bed!!! Also I found the room slightly noisy when I was trying to sleep, if I was to pick a fault.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay-would recommend to loved ones”
Reviews.Author: starletohara
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this great little hotel! I would recommend it to my family and friends without hesitation! V.friendly and attentive staff - particularly Francois (he really made a great effort on our arrival and left a great impression). There was a yummy continental breakfast every morning included in the room price that really set you up for a day of sight-seeing and free wifi available throughout the hotel that worked really well. There were snacks and drinks available in the lobby throughout the day & it is located minutes await from the metro stops at Pigalle & Blanche. Our bedroom was spotless and really warm - important for a stay in December! If I was to nitpick, I'd ask the hotel to take out the small shower doors in the bath and put in a longer door or a shower curtain (but I'm really nit-picking here!) because the water escaped out over the floor every time! But for the first time following many a visit to Paris, I've found a reasonably priced hotel, that I would without hesitation recommend to others! To the staff at the Monterosa, keep up the great work and thank you for making our trip such a pleasant one!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: jackie h
Reviews.Content: Just had a great weekend in Paris. I deliberated a lot before deciding on the Monterosa and we were not disappointed. Great location. We did lots of walking and it was really nice not to have to rely on the metro. All communal areas and our room were exceptionally clean which is a big plus and everything is in good working order. We stayed in a superior room and thank goodness we did as it wasn't huge but nice decor. Big plus for us was a surprise bottle of champagne in our room when we returned from a walk, it was our anniversary. That's such a nice touch, we were really pleased. Only down point was the rather grumpy night porter who wouldn't let me have a cup of tea late in the evening. The tea/coffee facilities close at 10pm, apparently. Oh well. We'd still go back. Buffet breakfast is included in room price at the moment and it's very nice. Hotels in Paris are so expensive and some way too over designed. This hotel is well located, mid range, clean and not disappointing. All you need for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Silvery
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in October 2011. For three nights, my husband and 1 year old daughter stayed with me. Wo got a nice room equipped with a new baby bed. Room and bathroom were very clean and quite big for Paris standards. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. Breakfast was included and free coffee and soft drinks, even some snacks, were available 24/24. I have stayed in a couple of hotels in Paris, and getting things for free and being treated so friendly is quite extraordinary here. I also had the feeling that families with small children were quite welcome. The only thing I could criticize is the badly constructed shower (the glass pane being too short so the bathroom gets flooded every time you shower) and that the windows seem to be not very well isolated. But these are minor worries. I you plan to stay at this hotel: There is a bus stoping right in Rue La Bruyere which goes directly to the Louvre. Of course there is also a metro station near by. And be on the lookout for Francois, the most charming and obliging hotel receptionist I ever met in Paris. This hotel is very good value, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: VickyChristinaBCN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monterosa for 7 nights in August. As you can imagine for that many nights, I put a lot of effort in trying to find a great hotel in Paris that wasn't the size of a match box, old, run down and with a horrible bathroom. This hotel is a RARE FIND! The rooms are modern, bright and super clean. The bathroom is also wonderfully clean and a great size by any standards. The hotel staff are another plus, with reception always going out of their way with restaurant or taxi bookings etc. I am vegetarian, and they even helped us locate a great place near Notre Dame. In the afternoon, they have free snacks in the lobby, which are so welcome after a day of sightseeing. The location is nice and close to Montmatre, and Sacre Coeur, but about a 10-15 minute metro ride from the city centre. My only suggestion would be for them to play some music in the fabulous breakfast room, as it can be a bit awkward with everyone eating in silence and the clinking of cutlery. Would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tiikeri2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Monterosa in October and were very impressed. The hotel is clean and airy - rooms are pretty small but normal size for Paris and immaculate - beds are very comfy! The free soft drinks at the bar are a nice touch and the breakfast was excellent. Lovely, quiet hotel, suitable for families and couples. I personally don't have an issue with the hotel being close to Pigalle and it's "red light" elements but families with young children may find it not suitable for them. Saying that, the area is very safe and there were families staying at the hotel during our visit so I would not let the close vicinity of Pigalle put you off! Hard to find any minus points but if I had to - the soundproofing isn't amazing at the hotel, the separate WC didn't have a basin in it and the shower/bath didn't have a shower screen - but that's trying really hard! I would thoroughly recommend the Monterosa to anyone and will be sure to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: aly13Liverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and were very happy with our choice. We got the RER and the metro (line 4 from Gare de Nord then line 12) from cdg airport (as you come out of St Georges metro you turn left if travelling in the direction of Maissie d'Issy), the walk from St Georges metro was about 5 minutes. We arrived at the hotel at 11pm and the receptionist was polite, friendly and helpful. All the receptionists were very good during our stay. Our room was quite small but bright/airy and most importantly spotlessly clean. The bed was really comfortable. All toiletries were restocked daily and towels/bed linen were changed daily. Breakfast was continental style, included in the price, served from 7am-10:30am. Having eaten late the night before we used to go down at 10am and it was very quiet and fully stocked. When we went down at 9.30am it was packed so I suggest go earlier or later to breakfast. There were no bolied eggs left one morning and the lady just made us some fresh eggs- no problem. Particularly welcome after a busy day sightseeing were the complimentary drinks and snacks available all afternoon and evening in the breakfast room. This included tea/ coffee/ water and cans of soft drinks. There were quite a few restaurants within a 10 minute walk. We really enjoyed Bistro Lorette (go left out of the hotel and left at the end of the road and its on your left), I have posted a review. We got a taxi back to the airport as we were running late, the hotel phoned it for us- the cost was 47 euros and it took about 1/2 hour at 7pm at night. Overall we really enjoyed our break in Paris and when we return we will definitely stay at this hotel again. PS: the lift was not working whilst we were there so I suggest you ask for a room on the 1st floor if you struggle with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Rumaiwa
Reviews.Content: Simple elegant hotel. While some rooms are very small, the double beds room is big enough. The breakfast is an added value and the free coffee and tea in the lobby all day long, makes the hotel very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Elegant, Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travellersfriend303
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location around 10 minute walk from Opera, five minutes from Moulin Rouge and 15 from Sacre Coeur Basillica. Roomy well decorated room, very clean and airy - air conditioned and well appointed. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast very good and cheerfully served in a pretty room with good atmosphere. Free hot and cold drinks available in the breakfast room in the afternoon and evening. We would recommend this hotel as good value and having the atmosphere expected and hoped for in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: wolac
Reviews.Content: clean, affordable, friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast and complementary afternoon snacks, if in paris again would return

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in late July 2011, in a room facing the pleasant, so very Parisian rue La Bruyère. Hotel offered reasonable rates and turned out to be excellent value. It was spotlessly clean, new, modern and elegant with a lovely, sunny lounge/dining area with books and other treats. Complimentary snacks and beverages of a nice quality were put out in the afternoon and evenings, tea and coffee were available always. Can also ask to have a kettle and tea and coffee tray placed in your room. Our superior twin was well sized, with a nice colour scheme and good quality bedding. Amenities included a large in-room safe, air conditioning, flat-screen TV with many different language channels and free Wi-Fi. The location, near Place Saint George in the charming, attractive Nouvelle Athènes neighbourhood is great -- immediate area very nice and a short walk to Montmartre and Opéra Garnier/Madeleine areas, les Grands Magasins (Printemps, Galeries Lafayette) and a delightful market street rue des Martyrs. Hotel staff were all very courteous and helpful. When we checked-in we were given several access codes for the free Wi-Fi, not just for a day's use as someone mentioned in an earlier review. The included continental breakfast was of good quality, with different fruits and yoghurts on different days, fresh juices, several cheeses, etc. Very close to hotel there are a couple of interesting smaller museums; Musée Gustave-Moreau which houses a wonderful collection of his works, and Musée de la Vie romantique dedicated to the Romantic movement (16 rue Chaptal, free entrance to the permanent collection). Transportation options are excellent -- buses and subway nearby and from Pigalle metro it's a direct ride to Gare du Nord and to the RER B train that goes to CDG airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for this price level. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: marinlicina
Reviews.Content: In short: Monterosa has it all for a short (one week or less) Paris stay, the quality of the rooms and service is impeccable at such an affordable level. Location is very good too, especially if you are prepared to walk a little. Open bar whole evening and afternoon with quality drinks and snacks is a fantastic bonus. Very friendly staff and very clean rooms. Rooms: 4/5 - Recently renovated, a bit design-ish and with good amenities. We had a sort of clothing rack (with plenty of hangers, 6 or 7) and a hanging textile substitute for planks (just see any IKEA catalog :) It's actually a good idea: you see all the stuff, no need for a huge closet taking up space and there's plenty of room for things. Bathroom is ok in size, nice shower and they have a good hair dryer. Nice, soft towels. Bed is quite large, very clean and matress nice and firm. The room has a safe. We had a street-side room, but the windows isolated the noise very well when shut. Only downside: the room is small, but the very high ceilings and smart layout make it feel much bigger. There's even room for a little desk and chair. There is airconditioning too, by the way. Location: 4/5 - It's near both Montmartre and Opéra (both about a 10-15 minutes walk). It practically means you're in the heart of touristic Paris, while the neighbourhood is still quiet and feels safe. Although near the Pigalle metro station (which seems filled with sleazy people trying to rip off tourists at night), there's none of that near the hotel. Be weary that if you come from the Opéra side of Paris with suitcases, that you have to walk slightly uphill to the hotel. So if you have lots of luggage, coming from the upper side (Pigalle) is better. Service: 5/5 - Ok, it's not a 5-star George V hotel on the Champs Elysees, but at this price level, the place doesn't get better: Friendly staff is very approachable, they speak good english and are willing to help out with whatever you need. The open bar is excellent: from around 2 PM until midnight you can get free drinks (non-alcoholic) and snacks of very good quality and variety. Take them up to the room as well, if you like. Wow. Especially in a city where 2 coffees and mineral waters usually cost above 10 euros in a café, I believe this really adds value. Overall, the hotel never feels as if they cut corners on you to earn money: free Wi-Fi (you can get codes for multiple devices), very nice and fresh breakfast buffet (included with our stay) and generous check-out times. Final remarks: * They have cool lobby / breakfast area with ample seating room. It's a really pleasant space to sit in (unlike most hotels), especially with free drinks. * The hotel has an elevator (we didn't need it, but I can imagine a bit older people or people with lots of luggage would like that). * Free Wi-Fi in lobby and rooms with excellent signal. They even asked how many devices we wanted to use (very nice).

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sazhom
Reviews.Content: The nearest metro stations to this hotel are St Georges and pigalle. Pigalle is known for being the red light district of Paris however having walked through it at night it seemed safe and not what u would typically expect of a red light district. The hotel is spotlessly clean, the staff are eager to help, breakfast is continental and had fresh cheese/ham etc, the rooms aren't that small as you expect in Paris and the decor is quite trendy. To get to the main sites in Paris is easy and there are lots of places to eat out in montmatre just up the hill, 10 mins from the hotel. Would definitely go back as even I that always find something to moan about couldn't find anything wrong with here!( Free wi-fi and drinks and snacks throughout the day too.)

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again....no problem!”
Reviews.Author: mascara1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in the early part of July, 2011. The place is spotlessly clean and well maintained. We asked for a room facing the back, and we heard absolutely nothing in the way of outside noise. The only noise came from inconsiderate hotel guests who insisted on announcing themselves to the world when they returned to their rooms at night. Although the lift was out of order the week of our stay, we were on the 1st floor (2nd floor in the USA) and it posed no problem. The breakfasts were ample and there was always something to put in the belly prior to the day's events. Earlier risers got the best selection, but we found that if you asked they would provide more of everything (except hard boiled eggs...a 1/2 hour wait if not immediately available). The front desk was always helpful. The rooms are tiny, but that's the standard in Europe. The mattresses were excellent as were the pillows. The bathrooms are nice and large, but (as others have mentioned) the shower was very funky, and got water all over the floor. Just throw your used towels on the floor and that solves that problem. I should also mention that the WiFi system is booming. No problems with reception at all, but you must renew your WiFi password DAILY by getting a new one at the desk. That's kind of dumb. I forgot to mention that there is a really nice restaurant at the far end of the street. A sweet couple run it. The hotel manager described it as "a place where the owner loves to cook". This hotel is located a couple of blocks from the Line 12 St. Georges Metro Stop. This is not a perfect hotel, but they work very hard to please. We enjoyed our stay in the extreme! Merci Hotel Monterosa!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: dublinsun79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of a Parisian Hotel.....small!! But the rooms were clean, modern, airy and in a relatively good location, bit of a walk to shops and restaurants but you wouldnt mind. Breakfast wasnt great wouldn't fill a pigeon, the room was always full and the waitress was terrible. Apart from that i would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Redirected here from another hotel in the group - pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: HereWhereEverythere
Reviews.Content: Didn't book to stay here directly but was booked in by another hotel in the same group after a mess up with our booking there. Pleasantly surprised by this hotel and actually quite happy to have had the opportunity to stumble across it. Room was very clean, large and brightly designed. Very friendly and helpful staff and great breakfast. In general I'd say it might be a little overpriced, but compared to the competition in Paris it's not actually that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - pleasant stay in central location”
Reviews.Author: MollyPearl
Reviews.Content: Had a fab stay at this hotel back in February for a long weekend in Paris. We selected the hotel based on the excellent reviews - and it certainly lives up to them! Really affordable, clean, new and close to Rue de Martyrs which happens to be one of my favourite streets in Paris for food. The bar downstairs meant we had a nice spot to chill after long days of walking and cycling around Paris. Will stay here again next time we're back. Only downside is that the walk from Pigalle isn't brilliant late in the evening, but this is fairly standard for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but more peaceful than I could ever believe for such a central location.”
Reviews.Author: PaulaGodden
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in a twin bedroom so that we could attend the French Open tennis. I have stayed in Paris a number of times before (including living and working there over a three month period) and this is the first time I have ever really appreciated and enjoyed staying in Paris. The location is truly superb. It is within a reasonable walking distance of the Metro underground service, Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge and Galleries Lafayette. The first night we were there was a very warm evening but we were able to sleep with the window wide open and were amazed at how peaceful it was. The room was small, but spotlessly clean and perfectly adequate. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We appreciated the free drinks (alcohol free) and nibbles in the evenings. Breakfast was a continental buffet (if you like a full cooked breakfast this is not the hotel for you) including fresh fruit. In the evenings we ate out within 10 minutes nwalking distance of the hotel and had wonderful meals. I have only good things to say about this hotel and will seek to stay there again should I make a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: surfguy38
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is absolutely fabulous. I stayed for 2 nights and regret it wasn't for longer. I look forward to my next trip to Paris and my stay here at this hotel. I couldn't find a single fault with it. In every way it surpassed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff, great room, great everything!”
Reviews.Author: faraway46
Reviews.Content: We researched Trip Advisor extensively to pick our hotel in Paris. We chose Monterosa because it seemed well located (close to L'Opera and Lafayette) and had nice revues. What a gem! Room is impeccably clean, quiet and with a large bathroom. The shower/tub was great with endless strong, hot water and great towels. There was no closet in the room but an open "clothes rack" which maybe is not the best style wise, but it was super comfy to hang clothes. The bed was a cloud, as were the pillows. Decor is modern and minimal. Hallways are VERY narrow, so a little troublesome dragging large luggage. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious, with room to spare for everybody. The staff is friendly and helpful. They gave complimentary snacks in the afternoon that included soft drinks, coffee, pastries, chips, pretzels, fruits, etc. all on the house. They mistakenly billed us twice and were extremely sorry and before we even arrived (we paid in advance) they had already fixed it. I would vote this hotel as best value for service in a heartbeat! Great pick!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: 528852Carol
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean spacious room with minimal furniture (another chair would have helped). Exellent bathroom with full bath and efficient shower. Superb cold buffet breakfast with everything anyone could want,fruits,cereals ,cheeses,salamis,fresh bread, croissants etc. all included in the price! This is served in a smart and spotless foyer. From late afternoon on there is tea and biscuits or pre-dinner snacks and bottled and canned drinks. The staff are helpful in booking local restaurants. There are some good ones nearby and a couple of good patisseries too.Busses run to the Louvre and the Ile da la Cite from the end of the road( taking about 20 mins)and the Moulin Rouge and Montmartre are a short walk away. Altogether an excellent and good value choice;wish we could find something comparable in London!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Monterosa”
Reviews.Author: TravelReens
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 3 days and this hotel was fabulous. Immaculate, updated and modern with large bathrooms. Jean-Francois and Phillipe were two of the front desk agents we encountered and they were both awesome. They were so friendly and helpful- I really felt lke I was coming home each day to this hotel. They have an 'open bar' for several hours each night which consists of snack food, sodas and coffees which is nice. Great central location very close to Moulin Rouge. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris, helpful english speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: KamandHema
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good value base to explore Paris, this is ideal! The staff are very friendly and speak very good english which is not always the case in Paris. Location is great near the Metro and walking distance to Galleries shopping centre. The rooms are compact but have all you need with a decent clean bathroom and air conditioning. The only issues we had were people smoking in the room nearby causing a nasty smell in our room and corridor and one night the fire alarm went off, otherwise a great place to stay! The free drinks and snacks in the afternoon and evening are a welcome bonus when returning from a days sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, cool decor, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: smart_0ne
Reviews.Content: The room (5th floor) was very cute and had character, was small, as to be expected in the attic of an old building. This was no problem. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Our clothing on the floor was picked up, folded and put away when the room was cleaned, a nice touch. The decor of the lobby/stairwells was v cool. The front desk staff were fantasic and helpful in finding a police station in the area, even printing out a map for us. They looked after our bags for the afternoon too after we checked-out. However, the lady supervising breakfast did not speak english seemingly and was loudly cleaning up tables at breakfast while we were trying to relax which was slightly off-putting. The maids cleaning the rooms around us in the morning were chatting loudly and there was a door somewhere that kept slamming.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful and modern boutique hotel with nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler75
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monterosa is a really fun small hotel in the 9th arrondissement near Pigalle. It's on a quiet street, which is nice since some of the surrounding streets can be quite loud at night. The rooms are cheerful and modern with good bedding and clean bathrooms. They are on the small side, but perfectly fine - you don't want to spend your time in the hotel anyway! The hotel offers breakfast in the mornings (for a supplement) and it has a nice variety of food choices. In the afternoon, free snacks and drinks are offered in the lobby lounge. The staff was very helpful to me when my flight got canceled due to strikes. They helped me rebook and found me a taxi to the airport (which was a minor miracle!). I definitely recommend Hotel Monterosa.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: brunswick29
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel. Great room, fantastic bed and lovely modern bathroom. Staff couldn't do enough for you, and the breakfast buffet was well worth the 13 euros. The free drinks and snacks from 2pm are a lovely touch and well worth it considering cost of coffee in Paris. All in all a great place to stay and made our stay in Paris extra special. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RafaelVidal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights early december with my family and simply loved the hotel. Everything is very clean and cute. The beds were very confortable and the free food and drinks downstairs was a plus. I have to add the fact that all employees were very friendly and helpful. A point to note is, as we were a group of ten and were using 5 rooms, we could definetly see that some were bigger than others especially considering the bathroom size. All in all, the hotel is an excellent choice in Paris. You can find 2 metro stations nearby, supermarkets and lots of restaurants/cafes..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chocolatefudgebrowni
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything it promised and more and for brilliant value. It was clean, modern, comfortable and in a perfect location (2 mins walk to the nearest metro). The staff were friendly and helpful and we were not bothered by anyone for any reason during our stay. There is also a free buffet of drinks and snacks downstairs every evening which was a very nice touch. Was worried before going by some of the reviews on here saying that the other room doors were very loud in the hall. They were no louder than in any other hotel, there is bound to be a bit of hustle of bustle in the hallway but apart from the odd bit of noise we found it very peaceful. Would definitely recommend it and would definitely return again. Can't say enough nice things about this place it's a credit to the management and staff and really contributed to our break away feeling carefree and peaceful !!!

Reviews.Title: “I love it”
Reviews.Author: Unrulymike
Reviews.Content: I never feel compelled to write a review, but in this case I had to. Friendly service, very clean and bright, great location and not expensive. No wonder this place has good reviews. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DK-NO
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good words to say about this hotel. It's just like in those good reviews I read from this site and other hotel sites. The place is clean, neat, stylish and as promised. No problem whatsoever and the receptionist speaks very good English. We had a pleasant stay and would surely come back again if we're going back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by all the good reviews on here!”
Reviews.Author: trael2
Reviews.Content: I am quite confused as to why the reviews for this hotel are so great.... I stayed here at the vastly inflated price of €229 per night (there were very few options as we booked late) having read the reviews and I stayed in a tiny single room (the whole room including bathroom was probably the size of my normal double bed at home). The decor was ok, the breakfast cost €15 so I didn't have it, the front desk staff were ok, the area was ok but nothing was good or recommendable to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from a stay at the monterosa...”
Reviews.Author: carpetdave
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay at the monterosa and I have to say the hotel is great lovely interior design and colours used nice touch with free soft drinks and snacks later in the day rooms are large for Paris And beds are huge super king Paid 165 euros which I thought was a good deal Only source of irritation was on checking out when one helpful fellow traveller had decided to charge his breakfast to my room The attitude of the man on reception let down all the good work the rest of his team had done. Minor stuff but I think that particular chap needs to seek out a new career 95% though and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: TravelledPlaces
Reviews.Content: Recently opened this hotel is a real gem both in terms of product and service. The rooms are small but nicely decorated, clean and functionally equiped with everything you need. There is a modernly designed lounge where breakfast is served and guests can use tea/coffee making facilities all day long as well as help themselves to soft drinks in the afternoon. Breakfast was surprisingly good and above average for this kind of hotel (good choice of food and drinks). The best was the staff - a real asset to this hotel: incredibly friendly and helpful. The receptionists as well as the Manager did their utmost to make our stay in Paris a most enjoyable experience: they managed to honour our request for an early check-in on the day of our arrival, made good restaurant recommendations and were courteous throughout. Above all they all spoke very good English, which is a rarity in Paris. All in all, a highly recommendable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “amazing surprise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaximilianBerni
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because the hotel I used to stay (Bradford Elysèes) was unfortunately fully booked. It was an amazing surprise. Its location is quite convenient and close to metro.The area is cozy and completely safe (Pigalle today is not the Pigalle area during the '70s..come on!!!)Front desk guys were unbelievably helpful, and they provided me with any kind of complimentary beverages during my stay; since I suffer from Claustrophobya, they gave me a large room with wide windows facing the street....and it's totally sound-proof!Don't trust who said it's not!I'm really picky about hotels and their cleanliness and everything there was perfect.The bathroom too is large (especially considering you are in Paris).Didn't have breakfast, but I saw it was very good and well arranged in this "design and boutique " hotel.Pricesof room are kinda cheap and I'd definitely recommend it to everybody.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Monterosa - Astotel Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 30, Rue La Bruyere | 9th Arr, 75009 Paris, France
